body_html:
#2 is a decent amount of work, so let's stick with #1
…
On Apr 14, 2017 12:42 PM, "Justine Tunney" ***@***.***> wrote: In that case I'd recommend one of the following: 1. Keep current approach and rename with_jemalloc to with_jemalloc_on_linux_x86_64 and rename linux_ppc64le to with_jemalloc_on_linux_ppc64le. 2. Investigate if jemalloc can just be enabled for all platforms if with_jemalloc is true. When I coded it this way IIRC I was erring on the side of caution and inheriting previous decisions. I haven't investigated what platforms jemalloc does and does not support. I would prefer (2) but it's probably more work. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#9214 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAKYw8uo7Cw0rjJ5F01bgFduYACdPiEeks5rv8wogaJpZM4M9jTv> .
body_text:
#2 is a decent amount of work, so let's stick with #1

…
On Apr 14, 2017 12:42 PM, "Justine Tunney" ***@***.***> wrote:
 In that case I'd recommend one of the following:

    1.

    Keep current approach and rename with_jemalloc to
    with_jemalloc_on_linux_x86_64 and rename linux_ppc64le to
    with_jemalloc_on_linux_ppc64le.
    2.

    Investigate if jemalloc can just be enabled for all platforms if
    with_jemalloc is true. When I coded it this way IIRC I was erring on
    the side of caution and inheriting previous decisions. I haven't
    investigated what platforms jemalloc does and does not support.

 I would prefer (2) but it's probably more work.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#9214 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAKYw8uo7Cw0rjJ5F01bgFduYACdPiEeks5rv8wogaJpZM4M9jTv>
 .
body:
#2 is a decent amount of work, so let's stick with #1

On Apr 14, 2017 12:42 PM, "Justine Tunney" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> In that case I'd recommend one of the following:
>
>    1.
>
>    Keep current approach and rename with_jemalloc to
>    with_jemalloc_on_linux_x86_64 and rename linux_ppc64le to
>    with_jemalloc_on_linux_ppc64le.
>    2.
>
>    Investigate if jemalloc can just be enabled for all platforms if
>    with_jemalloc is true. When I coded it this way IIRC I was erring on
>    the side of caution and inheriting previous decisions. I haven't
>    investigated what platforms jemalloc does and does not support.
>
> I would prefer (2) but it's probably more work.
>
> —

> .
>
